required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of a Home Rehabilitation Program vs an e-Health Program in Patients With Chronic Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Effectiveness of a Home Rehabilitation Program vs an e-Healt Program on Disability, Pain, Fear of Movement, Quality of Life and Spinal Mobility in Patients With Chronic Low Back Pain.

brief_summary.textblock: The main objetive of this study is to analyze the effectiveness of a home rehabilitaton program vs a e-Health program. Therapeutic approach will be by electroanalgesia and exercise of patients with chronic low back pain.

detailed_description.textblock: A double blind clinical trial will be developed in a sample of 80 subjects with chronic low back pain. Patients will receive 3 weekly sessions of electroanalgesia and an exercise program for 8 weeks, for a total of 24 sessions. The aim is to analyze the effectiveness of a home rehabilitation program vs a web platform program on disability, pain, fear of movement, quality of life, resistance of the trunk flexors, lumbar mobility in flexion and muscular electrical activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire (RMDQ).
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 8 weeks and at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: This is a self-reported questionnaire consisting in 24 items reflecting limitations in different activities of daily living attributed to low back pain including walking, vending over, sitting, lying down, dressing, sleeping, self-care and daily activities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in disability. Oswestry Low Back Pain Disability Idex.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 8 weeks and at 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: It has 10 items associated to activities of daily living, each ítem has a puntuation fron 0 to 5 points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in pain intensity. Visual analogue scale.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 8 weeks and at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: A 10-point Numerical Pain Scale (0: no pain, 10: maximum pain) assesses the intensity of pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Fear of Movement. Tampa Scale of kinesiophobia.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 8 weeks and at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Is a 17-item questionnaire that measures the fear of movement and (re)injury.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on Quality of Life. SF-36 Health questionnaire.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 8 weeks and at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: . SF-36 Health questionnaire scores range from 0 to 100% and indicate the self-perceived health-related quality of life.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 8 weeks and at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: It measures the isometric endurance of trunk flexion muscles.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in lumbar mobility flexion.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 8 weeks and at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: For the quantification of lumbar flexion an angular inclinometer is used (Fleximeter UM 8320-3 RJ Code Research Institute, Brazil).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in Lumbar electromyography.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 8 weeks and at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: The degree of electromyographic activation of the lumbar paravertebral musculature will be carried out by using a set of electrodes of 3x7 dimensions that will be applied uniformly in the lumbar region from the spinal level from L2 to L5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baselina in range of motion and lumbar segmental mobility
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 8 weeks and at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: This variable is quantified using the SpinalMouse ® device (Phisiotech, Spain). It is an electronic computer-aided measuring device that measures sagittal spinal amplitude of movement (ROM) and intersegmental angles in a non-invasive way.

arm_group.description: It consists in a home rehabilitation program. Patients will recieve electroanalgesia with TENS and an exercise program following the McKenzie method. At first and second sessions, patients will be instructed on how to use electroanalgesia and how to perform the exercises. Then, patients will perform the therapy at home. Patients will perform the treatment 3 times per week, for 4 weeks, with a total of 24 sessions

It consists in a support system for the treatment of chronic low back pain based on web technologies. The system can register a subject and provide a treatment of electroanalgesia and exercise through the Mckenzie method. Video applications of electroanalgesia and exercises will be shown to patients who use their computer or mobile device to access the platform through the Internet. The treatments will be recommended by the system based on the database that is configured to accommodate the application of electroanalgesia and McKenzie exercises based on the diagnosis according to the McKenzie method.patients will perform the treatment 3 times per week, for 4 weeks, with a total of 24 sessions

intervention.description: It consists in a home rehabilitation program performing electroanalgesia and an exercise program following the Mckenzie method. Patients will be instructed in the use of the TENS device using 5x9cm electrodes at the bilateral paravertebral level, the patients that present radicular pain, the electrodes will be placed in the path of the affected nerve. The realization of exercises will be through the application of an Mckezie protocol. The duration will be the same as that used to carry out the Mckenzie protocol. Mckenzie exercises are designed to make changes in the internal components periarticular of the spine.

It consists in an e-Health rehabilitation program through a web platform performing electroanalgesia and an exercise program following the Mckenzie method. Patients will be instructed in the use of the TENS device using 5x9cm electrodes at the bilateral paravertebral level, the patients that present radicular pain, the electrodes will be placed in the path of the affected nerve. The realization of exercises will be through the application of an Mckezie protocol. The duration will be the same as that used to carry out the Mckenzie protocol. Mckenzie exercises are designed to make changes in the internal components periarticular of the spine.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Low back pain ≥ 3 months.
- Age between 30 and 67 years old.
- Score ≥ 4 points on the Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire.
- Not being receiving physical therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of lumbar stenosis.
- Diagnosis of spondylolisthesis.
- Diagnosis of fibromyalgia.
- Treatment with corticosteroids or oral medication in recent weeks.
- History of spine surgery.
- Contraindication of analgesic electrical therapy.
- Have previously received a treatment of electrical analgesia or exercise.
- Central or peripheral nervous system disease.
- Agoraphobia
